TopicTitle: [Not Ingame Problem] Sorry but i need to know

Articles.Content:
how to know if someone "qoute" me?

Edited December 12, 2014 by cyberpawn

how to know if someone "qoute" me?

Like this.

P.S. Unless you see it, you don't. it ain't the chans.

P.P.S. Might have been better to ask in the off-topic section since it's not KSP but forumworks related.

AFAIK there's no way to receive notifications of when someone quotes one of your posts. Best you can do is subscribe to thread in which you post (you can set this up to happen automatically), then keep up with the threads.

The place to ask this question would have been the old forum forum which is now the Kerbal Network

If you go to that link you will find many questions and answers about the forum like how to do polls, the rep system and other fun stuff.

Also, to change `unanswered` to `answered` you edit your first post, select advanced and then you can change it there.

Edited December 12, 2014 by John FX
I think they might be adding that feature when the forums are moved.
That will be interesting. I`m quite curious about the new forum features.
